summary: This is a sealed federal indictment from the Southern District of New York charging Ghislaine Maxwell with conspiracy to entice minors to travel to engage in illegal sex acts, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and perjury. The indictment details Maxwell's alleged role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the sexual abuse of multiple minor girls by Jeffrey Epstein between approximately 1994 and 1997, and her subsequent false statements under oath in 2016.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with multiple counts related to conspiring with and facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls, and for committing perjury during a 2016 deposition.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the primary perpetrator of sexual abuse against minor girls, with Maxwell allegedly assisting him. He is named as a co-conspirator in the indictment.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the indictment as the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Described as having a close personal and professional relationship; intimate partners and co-conspirators in a scheme to sexually abuse minor girls.
Maxwell was paid by Epstein to manage his various properties.
Maxwell allegedly groomed and participated in the sexual abuse of Minor Victim-1, and enticed her to travel for abuse.
Maxwell allegedly groomed Minor Victim-2, provided her with an unsolicited topless massage, and encouraged her to massage Epstein.
Maxwell allegedly groomed Minor Victim-3, introduced her to Epstein, and arranged interactions knowing Epstein would sexually abuse her.
Epstein sexually abused Minor Victim-1 on multiple occasions in New York and Florida.
Epstein invited Minor Victim-2 to New Mexico for the purpose of grooming and sexual abuse.
Epstein sexually abused Minor Victim-3 on multiple occasions, including during massages.

events.title: Period of Alleged Conspiracy and Abuse
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein allegedly conspired to and did recruit, groom, and sexually abuse multiple minor girls at various locations.

events.title: Minor Victim-1 Travel from Florida to New York
events.description: Minor Victim-1 was enticed to travel from Florida to New York for the purpose of being sexually abused at Epstein's New York residence.

events.title: Massage of Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico
events.description: Maxwell provided Minor Victim-2 with an unsolicited massage in New Mexico, during which Minor Victim-2 was topless.

events.title: Grooming and Abuse of Minor Victim-3 in London
events.description: Maxwell groomed Minor Victim-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and encouraged her to massage him, knowing it would lead to sexual abuse.

events.title: Maxwell's First Deposition (Perjury Count)
events.description: During a deposition, Maxwell falsely testified she was unaware of any scheme by Epstein to recruit underage girls and denied interacting with anyone under 18 other than the plaintiff.

events.title: Maxwell's Second Deposition (Perjury Count)
events.description: During a deposition, Maxwell gave false testimony regarding her awareness of sex toys, Epstein's sexual activities with others, and whether she had ever given massages.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Ranch)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for the indictment)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with conspiracy, enticement, transportation, and perjury related to Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minors.
The indictment alleges Maxwell played a central role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the abuse of at least three minor victims (identified as Minor Victim-1, -2, -3) from 1994 to 1997.
Maxwell is accused of committing perjury during a 2016 civil deposition by denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme, his sexual activities with others, and her own involvement in giving massages.
The alleged abuse and grooming occurred at multiple Epstein-owned properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and at Maxwell's residence in London.
The indictment states Maxwell and Epstein had an intimate relationship and that Maxwell was paid by Epstein to manage his properties.
